definitions.definition: used when the person or people being spoken to both cause and are affected by an action

examples.text: You don't seem quite yourself today *(= you do not seem well or do not seem as happy as usual)*.

definitions.definition: used to emphasize the fact that the person who is being spoken to is doing something

examples.text: Do it yourself—I don't have time.
You can try it out for yourselves.
You yourself are one of the chief offenders.

definitions.definition: used instead of ‘you’ in order to sound polite or formal (although some people do not consider this use to be correct)

examples.text: We sell a lot of these to people like yourself.
How long were you by yourself in the house?
Are you sure you did this exercise by yourself?

definitions.definition: for only you to have or use; not shared

examples.text: I'm going to be away next week so you'll have the office to yourself.
